channel.title: [help] ddosing
channel.description:
How do you stop kids from ddosing your server , its really starting to piss me off , these kids with no lifes ddosing servers, get a life, seriously what happen to mopar.
help me out please.. would appreciate it. :confused:
thanks. :)

item.title: [help] ddosing
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

My Provider has a dummy server set up to take ddos attacks… Its packet flooding that usually trips people up though…

I think I solved it on my server.

Read full topic

item.title: [help] ddosing
item.dc:creator: @cr0ss cr0ss
item.description:
@cr0ss wrote:

Getting a dedicated server helps you alot. As soon as DDoSing occurs, reserve a support ticket and they will block the ip(s) or do something, if possible. Afterall, DDoSing is a real offense, which could bring serious fines or probably even jail, depends on country. : p

Read full topic

item.description:
@anc13nts1 wrote:

Shob I know a way people cant packet flood you but they can if they figure out the port and stuff

Read full topic

item.title: [help] ddosing
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“mapu, post:6, topic:224853”]There is free Ddos software available with linux, although i am unsure if it is effective against dynamic ip zombies. Just a guess there, but it is worth a try mate.

But i think regarding hosting, you have to cancel you current plan and re-do another plan under linux as they are different prices and different plans.[/quote]

Are you retarded?

[size=1][sub](rhetorical question)[/sub][/size]

Read full topic

item.title: [help] ddosing
item.dc:creator: @mapu mapu
item.description:
@mapu wrote:

There is free Ddos software available with linux, although i am unsure if it is effective against dynamic ip zombies. Just a guess there, but it is worth a try mate.

But i think regarding hosting, you have to cancel you current plan and re-do another plan under linux as they are different prices and different plans.

Read full topic

item.title: [help] ddosing
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

Yeah, I have had the same problem recently…

I am trying to figure out how to handle the packets 99 and 116…

Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: [help] ddosing
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“anc13nts1, post:2, topic:224853”]Lawlz…
First of all its not dosing holy crap.
It is called packet flooding. Since they are flooding your server on invalid packets 99 and 116.
So… That means fix that…
And whats your server name?[/quote]

Call me stupid, but the end result is Denial Of Service, which was achieved using a botnet (in other words a distributed attack).

If he can only flood 2 packets, then rofl.

Read full topic
